claim: The English Premier League recorded the highest total goals in the 2015/2016 season.
extra_info: league that had the most goals refers to MAX(SUM(home_team_goal, away_team_goal)); 2016 season refers to season = '2015/2016';
reasoning: In the 2015/2016 season, Spain LIGA BBVA had the highest total goals (1043), not the England Premier League (1026). The English Premier League was second.

content.text: I'll verify this claim step by step. Let me first explore the database schema, then query the data.

content.text: Now let me query to find which league had the highest total goals in the 2015/2016 season:

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/european_football_2.sqlite" "SELECT L.name, SUM(M.home_team_goal + M.away_team_goal) AS total_goals FROM Match M JOIN League L ON M.league_id = L.id WHERE M.season = '2015/2016' GROUP BY L.name ORDER BY total_goals DESC;"
input.description: Get total goals per league in 2015/2016 season

content.content:
Spain LIGA BBVA|1043
England Premier League|1026
Italy Serie A|979
France Ligue 1|960
Netherlands Eredivisie|912
Germany 1. Bundesliga|866
Portugal Liga ZON Sagres|831
Belgium Jupiler League|694
Scotland Premier League|650
Poland Ekstraklasa|635
Switzerland Super League|566

content.text:
The data clearly shows that **Spain LIGA BBVA** had the highest total goals (1043) in the 2015/2016 season, not the England Premier League (1026, which was second).

The claim states "The English Premier League recorded the highest total goals in the 2015/2016 season," but the data shows Spain's La Liga had more total goals (1043 vs 1026).

```json
{"label": "CONTRADICTED", "reasoning": "In the 2015/2016 season, Spain LIGA BBVA had the highest total goals (1043), not the England Premier League (1026). The English Premier League was second."}
```
